name: layer
content:
layer noun [C]
(MATERIAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 a level of material, such as a type of rock or gas, that is different from the material above or below it, or a thin sheet of a substance: the ozone layer A thick layer of clay lies over the sandstone. There was a thin layer of oil on the surface of the water. We stripped several layers of paint off the door.
More examplesFewer examplesCover the meat with a layer of cheese.Women have a layer of subcutaneous fat that provides them with better insulation than men.The eruption had covered the town with a fine layer of ash.A thick layer of dust had accumulated in the room.If the first layer isn't dry before you add the next one, the colours will run into each other .

layer noun [C]
(hair)
layers
[ plural ] hair cut so that some top parts of the hair are shorter than the hair underneath, to give it a particular style: I asked the hairdresser to put some layers in my hair.
See more
to arrange something in layers: Layer the pasta with slices of tomato. potatoes layered with onions
to cut hair so that some top parts of the hair are shorter than the hair underneath, to give it a particular style or shape: Can you layer it a little at the front, please?
